item.description:
Join "the FAN Alliance " for one of the most interesting times of year to visit Beaver Brook Association Nature Center in Hollis because it is the weekend of their Annual Fall Festival and Art&Photography show.  We will take a hike first from 2-3 or so to Spatterdock Pond and along Beaver Brook Trail.  Hopefully there will be some fall colors showing along the wetlands.  Before or after this hike (at 1 pm and 3 pm) there is a free presentation "Live Birds of Prey" by Wingmasters.  There is homemade food, live music and a nature art exhibit by over 70 regional artists in the historic Maple Hill Barn. So there is plenty to do and see if you come for a hike this day!

http://www.beaverbrook.org/welcome/calendar

11am-noon, fiddle and guitar music by Tina & Sierra Landel

12-1pm, "Songs of the Forest" by Amy Conley. 

1-1:50 and 3-3:50 pm, Julie Collier and Jim Parks of Wingmasters will present Live Birds of Prey from . Wingmasters
item.how_to_find_us: Meet at the Yurt at Beaver Brook Association 117 Ridge Road Hollis NH

group.name: Meeting & Greeting in So. NH & the Merrimack Valley :)

item.name: A Hike, Live Owls & Nature Art & Photography Show
